abstract: Alexander Rose reviews book A Higher Form of Killing: Six Weeks in World War 1 That Forever Changed the Nature of Warfare by Diana Preston.
lead_paragraph: In 1915, the Germans turned for the first time to weapons that targeted civilians as well as soldiers.

headline.main: ‘A Higher Form of Killing,’ by Diana Preston

snippet: In 1915, the Germans turned for the first time to weapons that targeted civilians as well as soldiers.
